rationale: Physics is branch of science mainly deals with interaction of energy and matter and considered as the mother of all engineering disciplines. Diploma engineers (technologists) have to deal with various materials while using/ maintaining machines. More over the basic knowledge of principles of physics helps diploma students to lay foundations of core engineering courses. The laws and principles of physics, formulae and knowledge of physical phenomena and physical properties provides a means of estimating the behavior of things before we design and observe them. This course of physics has been designed as per program requirements to help students to study the relevant core engineering courses. The complicated derivations have been avoided and micro projects are introduced. This course will help the diploma engineers to use/apply the basic concepts and principles of physics solve well designed engineering problems and comprehend different technology-based applications.
competency: Use principles of physics to solve broadly defined engineering problems.

courseOutcomes.description: Use relevant instruments with precision to measure the dimension of given physical quantities in various engineering situations.
Apply the concepts of electrostatics and capacitance for engineering applications.
Apply the basic concepts of heat transfer and thermometric properties to provide solutions for various engineering problems.
Use the concept of waves and sound waves for various engineering applications involving wave dynamics.
Use the concepts of LASER and Fiber optics for various engineering applications.

practicalExercises.description: Use Vernier calipers to measure the dimensions of a given object.
Use micrometer screw gauge to measure diameter of a given wire and determine volume of a given metallic piece.
Use a parallel plate capacitor to investigate the dependence of capacitance of a parallel plate capacitor on various factors.
Use principles of series and parallel combinations of capacitance in solving various electrical circuits.
Use different types of thermometers to measure temperature of a hot bath and convert it into different scales.
Use Searle's method to measure the coefficient of thermal conductivity of a given metallic rod.
Use Searle's method to determine the coefficient of linear expansion of the given metallic rod.
Use sonometer to find the frequency of given tuning fork.
Use resonance tube to determine velocity of sound in air at room temperature.
Determine the refractive index of given semi-circular glass block using TIR.
Determine refractive index of liquid by concave mirror.
Determine the value of the numerical aperture (NA) of given optical fibre.
Use ultrasonic interferometer to determine the velocity of ultrasonic waves in different liquids.
Use electrical vibrator to find the frequency of AC mains.

performanceIndicators.indicator: Operate the equipment setup or circuit

hardware: Vernier caliper analog - least count- 0.02 mm
Micrometer screw gauge analog (0-25 mm) – least count 0.01mm
Parallel plate capacitor (variable plate distance and area)
Mercury filled glass thermometer 0-110 °C, Mercury filled glass thermometer 0-250 °C., digital food thermometer, bimetallic thermometer
Linear expansion apparatus, steam generator, rubber tubing, metal rods
A Sonometer with a tuning fork set and two sharp edge wedges and a weight box
Resonance tube apparatus, tuning forks of different frequencies, rubber pad, thermometer
Complete set up to determine numerical aperture (NA) of optical fiber with LASER source
Ultrasonic interferometer - gold plated quartz crystal, operating voltage - 220 Volt, display - analog, frequency - 2MHz with position control
Electrical Vibrator, uniform cord, weight pan, weight box, pulley, meter scale, sensitive balance

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member
Practice environmentally friendly methods and processes

unitOutcomes.description: Explain physical quantities and their units
Convert unit of a given physical quantity in one system of units into another systems of units
Explain methods to measure the dimensions of given object by using relevant instruments
Estimate errors in the measurement
Apply the concept of least count, errors and significant figures to solve the given problems

topics.title: Measurement and units in engineering and science
Physical quantities; fundamental and derived quantities
Systems of units: CGS, MKS and SI, definition of units (only for information and not to be asked in examination), Interconversion of units MKS to CGS and vice versa, requirements of standard unit
Vernier caliper, Micrometer screw gauge
Accuracy, precision and error, estimation of errors - absolute error, relative error and percentage error, error propagation, significant figures

unitOutcomes.description: Explain Coulomb's inverse square law and apply it on system of charges
Explain an electric field, electric flux, electric potential and potential difference
Explain the concepts of a capacitor, capacitance and working of parallel plate capacitor
Apply the concept of series and parallel combination of capacitors to solve problems in electrical circuits

topics.title: Charge, unit of charge, Coulomb's law
Electric field, electric field lines and its properties
Electric flux, electric potential and potential difference (point charge only)
Capacitor and its capacitance. (C = Q/V), Working of the parallel capacitor, formula C = ε₀A/d, types of capacitors: Plane, spherical & cylindrical (Information only)
Equivalent capacitance of capacitors in series and in parallel combinations
Effect of dielectric material on the capacitance of parallel plate capacitor. (No Derivation)

unitOutcomes.description: Distinguish between Heat and Temperature
Explain modes of heat transmission
Explain various temperature scales and conversion between them
Explain Heat Capacity and Specific Heat
Explain types of thermometers and their uses
Apply the concept of coefficient of thermal conductivity to solve engineering problems
Explain expansion in solids and coefficient of linear expansions in solids

topics.title: Heat and Temperature
Modes of Heat transfer: Conduction, Convection and Radiation
Temperature measurement scales: Kelvin, Celsius and Fahrenheit and interconversion between them
Heat Capacity and Specific Heat
Types of thermometers (Mercury thermometer, Bimetallic thermometer, Platinum resistance thermometer, Pyrometer) and their uses
Coefficient of thermal conductivity and its engineering applications
Expansion of solids, coefficient of linear expansion

unitOutcomes.description: Explain wave and wave motion with example
Distinguish between longitudinal and transverse waves
Explain frequency, periodic time, amplitude, wave length and wave velocity
Explain sound waves, light waves and their properties
Explain amplitude, phase, phase difference and wave equation
Explain principle of superposition of waves, interference and beat formation
Explain ultrasonic waves, production and their properties
Explain engineering and medical applications of ultrasonic waves

topics.title: Waves, wave motion, and types of waves: longitudinal and transverse waves
Frequency, periodic time, amplitude, wave length and wave velocity and their relationship
Properties of sound and light waves
phase, phase difference and various terms of wave equation (y = Asin(ωt + φ)) [NO equations of velocity and acceleration]
Superposition of waves, Interference: constructive and destructive interference, condition for stationary interference pattern, beat formation
Ultrasonic waves, production of ultrasonic waves – magnetostriction and piezoelectric method, their properties, applications of ultrasonic waves in the field of engineering and medical

unitOutcomes.description: Apply Snell's law to calculate refractive index of given medium
Explain the phenomenon of total internal reflection
Explain LASER and it's in engineering and medical applications
Explain construction and working principle of step index and graded index optical fibers
Comprehend engineering and medical applications of optical fiber

topics.title: Refraction, refractive index and Snell's law
Total internal reflection, critical angle and necessary conditions for total internal reflection
Application of total internal reflection in optical fire
LASER, characteristics of LASER, differences between LASER and ordinary light
Applications of LASER in engineering and medical field
Optical fiber and light propagation through optical fiber, acceptance angle and numerical aperture
Step index and graded index
Applications of optical fiber in engineering and medical
Advantages of optical fiber over coaxial cable

studentActivities: Prepare model to demonstrate concepts of physics
Give seminar on any relevant topic
Measure physical quantities using smart phone
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/sub topics
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities
Guide students on how to address issues on environment and sustainability using the knowledge of this course

microProjects.title: Measurement
microProjects.description: Measure physical quantities using smart phone applications

microProjects.title: Prepare proto type Vernier calipers
microProjects.description: Prepare proto type Vernier calipers of given least count

microProjects.title: Arduino
microProjects.description: Physical quantities such as Voltage, Magnetic field, Temperature, Light, Sound and distance can be measured with the help of low-cost sensors and Arduino

microProjects.title: Paper Capacitor
microProjects.description: Aluminum foil and tissue paper can be used to make cylindrical capacitor

microProjects.title: Variable capacitor
microProjects.description: Two copper cylinders and plastic pipe can be used to make variable capacitor

microProjects.title: Sugar and bending of light
microProjects.description: prepare a solution of sugar and water to demonstrate bending of light (using semiconductor LASER)

microProjects.title: Fiber optics
microProjects.description: prepare an optical fiber cable using transparent flexible plastic tube, laser and water to demonstrate the property of optical fiber cable

programOutcomes.description: Engineering practices for society, sustainability & environment
